Projects.description: Room Design is built using React.js and TailwindCSS.  Utilizing these frameworks, I created a functional front-end site that includes some featues I have never worked on before.
Projects.Content: By creating a shopping cart within the site, I was able to use React States to add items to an overall cart, as well as changing the quantity or deleting from the cart itself.  This was the biggest challenge I had, but implementing and seeing it work was a huge success for me.  I also used states and React Router for the navigation bar on mobile, allowing for the user to change pages.  Finally, I created this site using a mobile-first approach, allowing the user to use this site in mobile, tablet, or desktop form, with different layouts depending on the size of the screen. Overall, I found that states are much more difficult in a multi paged site, and am looking forward to learning some Redux to help with states on a project of a larger size.

Projects.description: Tip Jar was created from the thought of having a quick and easy way to figure out a tip without needing to do the math yourself.
Projects.Content: Utilizing React.js and using TailwindCSS for the first time, I wanted to focus on buidling a good looking web app.  Using react states allowed for me to carry the balance of the check, and utilize different states based on the tip percentage clicked, or set a specific amount.  By using Tailwind, I was able to quickly put together a clean looking site.  I even delved into the specifics of adding my own stlyes through color optiosn and font inside of tailwind configs extend option. Overall I a, happy with the process and learned a lot on how states and tailwind work.
